fol.76v
To Cap
t
Antony Wingfeld. Fe
b
14 1590
fol.76r
Belgia 1591 Stilo Ro
m
14 Fe
b
To Cap
t
Anthony Wingfeild
Belgia: 1591: Feb
r
S
r
It had bin very requesit that yo
u
had taken a
copie bothe of her
Ma
t
commission & of her Instructions
to my
L. President
. For yt might have
s
ved yo
r
turne not onely the better to satisfie others, but
for yt self in like manner to direct yo
r
owne
ceeding
I have heerw
th
sent yo
u
the transcript of the
commission w
ch
you may kepe to yo
r
self or shew
to whom you please, but w
th
all I must signify, that
seing her Hig
nes
hath ordained, that
e execution of
these matters shall
ceed w
th
my advise. I know not
how it will stand that hath bin don in other sort.
For what my opinion ys for the cassing of
e Comp
ies
I declared heer at
e Hage to my L Presydent, &
as I have also written to
t
effect unto my
L.
Treasurer
, that yt is a course full of truble & dange
r
&
t
yt will in a maner bee
e ruin of
e
Comp
ies
, & w
th
all I am
swaded, that though they bee
cassed, & their pay detayned, yet they shall not
onely bee stopped of theyr passage, but they shall
have vittailes for a time at
e charg
of
e Countrey,
w
ch
I thinke they will minister, till they heare
how her Ma
ty
will accept of the reasons of theyr
refusall. In a matter of this moment
e best
advise
t
I can give, w
ch
I my self will also foll
[ow]
in as much as may concerne any
te of my charge
is to attend th
r
uppon what her Hig
nes
will resolve,
w
ch
no dout
e Importance of the cause yt self
the earnest l
re
s of
e
States,
& my L. President
presence will
cure very speedily. This is a
[.]
in this matter that I can answere unto yo
u
, having
onely for yt self to assure yo
u
furder, that if
[.]
chance to have occasyon to trye my affection un
[to]
yo
u
shall find mee ev
r
y waie as forward, as any
[.]
yo
u
shall motion can any way require,
& so
[&c]
Hage. 14 Feb
r
1590.
